description: when nextcloud version 25 will be available in the app store
good
Fighting to install it for several hours. I gave up
Nextcloud is a great app and this flatpak just works out of the box
The fork by the original ownCloud author, Nextcloud iterates and surpasses its predecessor. Nextcloud lets you take back control of you data. This flatpak client works flawlessly!
Works as good as the native Client. I use it on Arch with Gnome. Flatpack is way easier than using the AUR Package.
Using Nextcloud for everything. Better than any proprietary offering.

I using nextcloud for personal notes and documents that I then sync to my linux laptop and android phone.
Works great. One thing I dont like is non being able to run in the background in gnome DE.

(I'm new to linux so apologies if this is the wrong place for this.)

description:
Got a one star as it did not install as expected. This app should have the ability to install via the Ubuntu Software store without issue as expected. "One Click Install"
Application is great once it is working as expected!

### Issue I encountered ###

--------------------------------------------------------------

chmod: changing permissions of '/var/snap/nextcloud/13968/apache/logs': Operation not permitted
Making sure nextcloud is setup...
chmod: changing permissions of '/tmp/pids': Operation not permitted
chmod: changing permissions of '/tmp/sockets': Operation not permitted
chmod: changing permissions of '/tmp/pids': Operation not permitted

chmod: cannot access '/var/snap/nextcloud/common/nextcloud/tmp': Permission denied
chmod: changing permissions of '/var/snap/nextcloud/13968/nextcloud/extra-apps': Operation not permitted
Waiting for PHP…
--------------------------------------------------------------
# Work Around #

--------------------------------------------------------------
open your terminal 
~$ sudo snap remove nextcloud
then 
~$ sudo snap install nextcloud
nextcloud 15.0.10snap1 from Nextcloud✓ installed

description: You don't need to click on Launch, just Install, allow the Permission and open your browser at http://localhost. After clicking Install it might take a while, if it fails try again, mine worked on the second try. If you need to modify the snap settings see instructions at https://github.com/nextcloud/nextcloud-snap
summary: Don't click Launch, just install and open http://localhost

description:
after install you need to run , sudo nextcloud.manual-install anyUser anyPassword 

after that you can open your browser type localhost

When you Launch this program, it shows chmod: errrors 
and "Waiting for PHP...".  This is OK! 
It is running a php web server in the background.

Because it is designed to be run on a remote computer, 
the graphical interface is over the web.

Open up Firefox and go to "localhost". 
You can create a login and set up your Nextcloud instance.
summary: Runs a web server when launched - use a browser to see it

description: Hint: This is the server - not the desktop client.

Correct way to install Nextcloud:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:nextcloud-devs/client;
sudo apt-get update;
sudo apt install nextcloud-client
If you follow the workaround mentioned below by someone then you'll probably get it to install. But there's no point because it doesn't sync nor does there seem to be any means to update it either.

description:
Jan 3, 2020

Although i received error when launching from the software store. Nextcloud server works from the web browser.

Just launch your browser and put in either localhost or 127.0.0.1 the nextcloud admin page should show up. If not, do a "sudo snap start nextcloud" and reload your browser page. The admin page should show up to setup the admin user and password.
summary: Error when launching from software store, but works in web browser

description: permissions. see other gazillion commenter

I've set this up for my family on raspberry pi and it was used so much that I am moving it to an AMD64 machine for more speed and so I can start working with my rpi again! 

It can be difficult but there is a lot of good information out there on setting it up. 

One issue I had was that the time out in Fetcher.php for the app store is set at 10, where I need more like 300 or 600 because I have an extremely slow connection (450 KB/s) and because its a snap the file is read only. But I was able to work around it.
fix this issue not working linux min not show nextcloud

For those who have this permission issue, just download the Appimage file in the nextcloud installation webpage (https://nextcloud.com/install/#install-clients), then do:
chmod +x Nextcloud-2.6.4-x86_64.AppImage
in the command line where your file is located (you can also move the file in your ~/bin directory to have a "clean" location for nextcloud). Then just double click on the file in your file browser to launch nextcloud.
Doesn't work at all. Will try download it directly from Nextcloud website and install it manually.

description: The official Nextcloud desktop client is released by Nextcloud GmbH in the Ubuntu software catalog. This is not the official client but a Nextcloud impersonator. This app does NOT install a Nextcloud desktop client on your machine, but instead attempts to run who-knows-what code with a bunch of permission errors which people have been reporting for 9+ months. Observed this app's Updated date in the future on a US time zone evening, indicative of eastern European or Chinese (or similar) time zone. Who knows what they are trying to pull here! Beware! Look for the desktop client released by the company themselves!
PHP stuck issue, won't run
Nextcloud is nearly impossible to install, thought this would help, couldn't have been more wrong.
summary: Same as above Dose not work

description:
The snap has been updated to NextCloud 18 and includes OnlyOffice by default. The previous reviews describing permission issues are no longer accurate, as they are about a year old at this point. I tested many of the extensions, and they work as expected, too.
If you are going to use this for more than one or two people or are going to expose it to the internet, get a docker image. This one is http and sqlite by default.

description:

sudo apt upgrade

description: the command to connect it does NOTHING
Waiting for PHP ...
Install snap, connect all component, good to go in few second.
Just don't work
Easiest way to setup nextcloud.

sudo snap connect nextcloud:removable-media

sudo mkdir -p /media/nextcloud

sudo vim /var/snap/nextcloud/current/nextcloud/config/config.php

 'datadirectory' => '/media/nextcloud/data',

sudo snap disable nextcloud

sudo mv /var/snap/nextcloud/common/nextcloud/data /media/nextcloud

sudo snap enable nextcloud

sudo snap restart nextcloud.php-fpm
### DONE

All clues are here: https://github.com/nextcloud/nextcloud-snap
Badrrgyh(-hyhbb
Latest version of Ubuntu, NC client installed from Ubuntu Software store, not working.

There are permission issues and it does not install!
Proper way from command line 

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:nextcloud-devs/client
sudo apt update
sudo apt install nextcloud-client

Only problem: access to external "local" folder. The snap edition seems to give problems with account permissions. I solved using sftp-ssh to access folders of the local user (or other computer in lan or in internet). 
Certificate is easy to install, download certbot from snap store, then run: sudo nextcloud.enable-https lets-encrypt. Then check trusted domain folder to access from remote.
The OS doesn't seem to detect, that this program is installed at all.
I love owning my data

I'm running Nextcloud on a little PC under Ubuntu, mainly accessing it via my iPhone; it's easy to up- and download fotos, documents, music...with the Nextcloud app in iOS
The server is easy to install and to configure (I'm using the snap), including the https part. Updates are applied automatically.
And I've only touched very few of all the options so far: looking fwd to discover more. 
It's a great piece of software, thanks to everybody contributing to it!!
summary: great as personal cloud; no issues at all

description: Ubuntu doesn't recognise that it's installed.
Great, but if manually installed. Snap package is isolated, and system doesn't catch integration.
There are a few comments here about the OS not recognizing if it is installed. Just visit "localhost" in your web browser.

Läuft super und perfomant. Der einzige Nachteil ist meiner Meinung nach, dass die Einrichtung nicht so einfach ist, insbesondere wenn man als Datenspeicher eine nicht-system-Festplatte nutzen möchte, doch hier hilft einem das WWW gut. Klare Empfehlung.

Liebe Linux Frickler, macht doch einmal etwas vollständig so dass es ohne zusätzlicher Frickelei funktioniert. Kein Wunder warum sich Linux nicht gegen Windows durchsetzt. So geht es niemals!

Ich habe mich über die schlechten Bewertungen gewundert, da das bisher immer echt gut funktioinert hat. 
Installiert, Browser geöffnet, 127.0.0.1 eingegeben und das Ding funktioniert. Ich kam direkt drauf, konnte den Admin Account einrichten und hatte direkt eine Nextcloud bereitstehen die funktioniert. Mich würde wirklich interessieren, warum das bei so vielen Probleme macht.

Nextcloud funktioniert einfach nur. Kann die 1 Sterne nicht verstehen. Habe beim ersten mal Google gefragt und habe schritt für schritt eine Anleitung befolgt. Alles klappt einwandfrei. Benutze die Android App zum Synchronisieren. Der Spaß dabei ist der Weg. So lernt man Linux besser kennen...
Startet nicht - Waiting for PHP

Installation auf neu installiertem Ubuntu Desktop 20.04 LTS, vernünftig schneller PC. Alles läuft extremst langsam. Anzeige des Login dauert fast zwei Minuten, Anmeldung nochmals so lange. Die einzelnen Apps dauern zwischen 50s und 3min, bis die Anzeige steht. Da muss ein systematischer Fehler vorliegen.

War bisher begeister, aber nach dem letzten Update war Nextcloud nicht mehr nutzbar (DB war komplet leer), auch nach deinstallation und Neuinstallation keine Funktion. Hoffe das es mit dem nächsten Update wieder funktioniert.
summary: Bisher klasse, aber Irgendwas war beim letzten Update faul

An alle, die denken, dass dies hier die Nextcloud "App" ist: Nein, ist sie NICHT. Beschreibung lesen würde Abhilfe schaffen. Es ist der SERVER und dieser macht wirklich genau das, was er soll. Die Einrichtung ist wirklich einfach. Für genau sowas sind "Snaps" echt wunderbar.

description:
Ne veut pas se lancer
Indique une problème de permission (chmod
Why don't you make software that works !
je deteste ca ne marche pas

Cette application permet de créer votre propre serveur cloud sans grande difficulté.

Elle tourne chez moi depuis deux ans sans problème sur un petit PC type barebone qui me sert aussi de PC multimédia.

Les correctifs et mises à jour sont bien déployés par la communauté qui maintient ce package.

Ce qu'il faut bien comprendre pour une première mise en place pour des non avertis :
- l'application ne se lance pas comme une application ordinaire type word, excel, ou autre : vous accédez à votre serveur en tapant son adresse IP dans un navigateur web (chrome, firefox ou edge). Ou si l'application Nextcloud est installée sur le même PC que le navigateur : en tapant localhost dans la barre d'adresse
- pour accéder au serveur depuis l'extérieur de votre réseau domestique il faut configurer les redirections de ports 443 et/ou 80 de votre routeur ou box internet pour qu'ils pointent vers l'IP de votre serveur.
- pour pouvoir se connecter facilement depuis l'extérieur, il est préférable de créer un nom de domaine (avec duckdns.org, ovh ou autre). Par exemple, pour avoir une adresse de type https://monserveurcloud.duckdns.org.
- Il est préférable d'attribuer une IP locale fixe pour le serveur au niveau de votre routeur
summary: Une excellente application pour qui veut se libérer des GAFA's clouds

description: Problème de droit ...
De nombreux problèmes de permissions et une application non reconnue par le gestionnaire de logiciel. Inutilisable en l'état.

description: doesn't run. errors creating directories, followed by "waiting for php". fun times.

Une véritable suite pour se libérer de Google et autres, et le tout personnalisable à souhait ! Cette application m'a fait découvrir le plaisir de s'auto-héberger. 

Accessible depuis 127.0.0.1
Ou encore mieux : apprenez à vous auto-héberger avec Yunohost (qui facilite grandement le boulot et vous donne un nom de domaine) et installé Nextcloud dessus :D
Facile à installer ainsi qu'a configurer.

Si je ne me goure pas, c'est le paquet à installer sur un serveur pour faire du service cloud, pour se connecter à un compte comme utilisateur et synchroniser un dossier, c'est le client nextCloud qu'il faut.
